Row.Text: +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all melee units. Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.
Orc unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Culture] Culture on combat victory
Orc unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Faster in the Woods and Jungles and this features doesn't block sight for them.
Orc unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Faster in the Woods and Jungles and this features doesn't block sight for them.
Orc and Tauren unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.

A Orc unique improvement that can be build anywhere in his territory. Occupying unit receives +6[ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. Gives 1 Housing and +1[ICON_Production] an another +1 [ICON_Production] if its next to a Encampment.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.

Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. Rainforest tiles provide +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for Neighborhoods built adjacent to them. +100% Harbor district adjacency bonuses. All units heal every turn, even after moving or combat.
All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle. Additional Wildcard policy slot.

Troll unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.
Troll unique Medieval era range unit, replace Archer. Less attack than the Archer, but can attack twice per turn. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.
Troll unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace crossbowman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. cavalry units and more Combat defense. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.
Troll unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Faster in the Woods and Jungles and this features and -3 [ICON_Strength] to enemies next to him.
Troll unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Faster in the Woods and Jungles and this features and -3 [ICON_Strength] to enemies next to him.
Troll and Undead unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Unique Troll building that replace the temple. Gives 1 Housing , 4 [ICON_Faith] Faith, 2 [ICON_Culture] and +1 Points for Great Prophets and Generals.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.
All farms gain +1 extra [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park.

All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Plains and +1 MP when start in open terrain. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to the Tauren provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for the Tauren.

Tauren unique Medieval era anti-cavalry unit, replace pikeman. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Tauren unique Medieval cavalry unit, replace Knight and doesn't require Iron. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Tauren unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Unique Tauren building that replace the temple. Gives 1 Housing , 4 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 Points for Great Prophets and Generals. If there is Deers or Furs in that city, gives +1 extra [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Forsaken undead, free from the Lich King
All units when they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points and do not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Additional Military policy slot. Capture defeated enemy units as Builders.
Undead unique Medieval era melee unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.
Forsaken unique siege unit, replace the Catapult. It has less attack than the normal catapult but its much faster.
Forsaken unique recon unit, replace the Scout. Its a ranged unit and stronger than the scout and the archer but it requires the tech Archery.

Unique Forsaken building that replace the University. Gives 1 Housing , 4 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 Points for Great Scientists. If there is Incense, Mercury or Spices in that city, gives +1 extra [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Culture] Culture each.

Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Luxury resources in his territory provide an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to 2 extra cities.
All units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Elven unique Medieval era melee unit, replace the Swordsman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs Ranged Units and +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. ranged attacks.
Elven unique ranged unit, replace the Crossbowman. It has more attack than the Crossbowman and heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Elven unique recon unit, replace the Scout. Its a ranged unit and stronger than the scout and the archer but it requires the tech Archery.
Elven unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.

Unique Blood Elf improvement. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if next to a wonder. Cannot be built next to another Arcane Sanctum and only in Plains or Grasslands.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.
+4 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each city-state you are Suzerain of. +1 [ICON_Production] in all Mines and Lumber Mills

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for the Goblins. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to the Goblins provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for the Goblins. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities. Additional Economic policy slot.
Goblin unique air unit, its available earlier in the game. Requires Iron.
Goblin unique unit, replace the Knight. Its stronger than the Knight but slower and expensive.
Goblin unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Slower but no Combat Strength and Movement penalty when attacking from sea or river.
Unique Goblin Building that replace the Bank and can be build earlier in the game. Gives +6 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Production] and +2 Points for Great Merchants.

Unique Goblin Building that replace the Workshop. Gives +3 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 Points for Great Engineer and +1 Points for Great Scientist. Provides two slots for Air Units.

All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era).[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold for routes to other civilizations, and bonus [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production for routes between your own cities. All found or conquered cities on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to an Ally's city provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Production] Production for both cities.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
Stormwind unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.
Human and Dwarf unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Stormwind unique building that replace the Monument. Gives 3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, 1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and 1 [ICON_Production] Production.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.
Industrials Zones gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production if they are next to a Mountain. All mines gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 1 [ICON_Production] Production.

Snow terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. Each Archaeological Museum holds 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts instead of 3 and can support 2 Archaeologists at once. Archaeological Museums are automatically themed when they have 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts.
Dwarf unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. Stronger than the normal Crossbowman.
Dwarf unique Medieval era siege unit, replace Catapult. +7 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength vs. district defenses.
Dwarf and Gnome unique air unit, its available earlier in the game. Requires Iron.
Dwarf unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. +4[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in hills and faster on hills.
Dwarf unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. +4[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in hills and faster on hills.

Dwarf unique building that replace the Barracks. +40% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in this city. Gives 2 [ICON_Production] Production, 2 Points for Great Generals and 1 Housing. Occupying unit receives +2 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. Adds to air slots.
All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest and cannot be seen in the woods. Woods and Rainforest without [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty.

Forest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park.
Night Elf unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. More visibilaty range and ranged combat that normal Crossbowman and 150% of Flanking Bonus.
Night Elf unique Medieval melee unit, replace Swordsman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Night Elf unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Can move after attacking.
Night Elf unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Can move after attacking.
Night Elf unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.

Unique Night Elf building that replace the temple. Gives 1 Housing , 4 [ICON_Faith] Faith, 2 [ICON_Culture] and +2 Points for Great Prophets. A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the holy district.
Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. Doubles [ICON_Faith] Faith yield from the Shrine

+5 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each civilization (including Draenei) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war. Automatically receive the final Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if you have not earned a Great Prophet already).

Draenei unique Medieval era melee unit, replace Swordsman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory and heals every turn, even after moving or combat.

Dranei unique Medieval cavalry unit, replace Knight. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Draenei unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Draenei unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Draenei unique Medieval support unit, replace Medic and can its available earlier in the game. Can heal adjacent units.
Draenei unique improvement that only can be place if there is Diamonds or Gypsum. Gives +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold , +2 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.
All units have 1 additional Movement and the melee units can move after attacking.
All units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory. All your Routes between your cities give 2 [ICON_Food] Food and 2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Gilnean unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.

A Greymane Wall unique improvement. Provides an increase to [ICON_Strength] Defense and 1 [ICON_Culture]. Bonus to [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to other segments after reaching Technology of Castles. Must be built in a line along the borders of your empire.
Industrials Zones gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production if they are next to a Mountain. All mines gives 1 [ICON_Food] Food. Builders receive an additional charge.

+100% Campus and Industrial Zone district adjacency bonuses. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to the Gnomes provide +2 [ICON_Production] Production for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for the Gnomes.
Gnome unique unit, replace the Knight. Its stronger than the Knight but slower and expensive.
Gnome unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Faster than the Horseman and even faster if it starts in open terrain.

Unique Gnome Building that replace the Workshop. Gives +3 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +3 Points for Great Engineer and +1 Points for Great Scientist. Provides two slots for Air Units.

Builds Holy Sites districts in half the time. All found or conquered cities on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against the Argent Crusade.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. Combat victories provide [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
Argent Crusade unique unit, replace the Swordsman. This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged and heals after defeating an enemy unit.
Unique Argent Crusade building that replace the Arena. Gives 3 Entretainment , 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, 1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and 2 Points for a Great General.
Tundra and Snow terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations.
Can capture defetead units as Ghouls. All units have no combat penalties when injured. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Scourge unique unit, replace the Warrior. Heals after defeating an enemy unit.
Scourge unique unit, replace the Swordsman. Stronger than the Swordsman.
Scourge unique ranged unit, replace the Crossbowman.+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Tundra or Snow.
Scourge unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Can move after attacking.

Scourge unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Scourge unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Scourge unique unit that replace the Cavalry. Can be obtain earlier in the game but is more expensive.

A Scourge unique improvement that can be build anywhere in his territory. Occupying unit receives +6[ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. Gives 1 Housing and +1[ICON_Production] an another +2 [ICON_Production] if its next to a Lumber Mill.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.
All units heal every turn, even after moving or combat. Forest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Holy Site, and Theater Square districts.

All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest and cannot be seen in the woods. Woods and Rainforest without [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Troll unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.

Amani Troll unique Medieval era light cavalry unit, replace Horseman. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Amani Troll unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

A Troll unique improvement that can be build anywhere in his territory. Occupying unit receives +4[ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. Gives 1 Housing and +1[ICON_Culture] an another +1 [ICON_Culture] if its next to a Lake. +1[ICON_Faith] Faith for being next to a Forest or Jungle.

Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. Rainforest tiles provide +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for Neighborhoods built adjacent to them. +100% Harbor district adjacency bonuses. All units heal every turn, even after moving or combat.

All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle. The worship building for their Religion can be purchased by any player for just one-tenth of the usual [ICON_Faith] Faith cost. All Relics provide bonus Faith (+1).
Unique Gurubashi Troll building that replace the Arena. Gives 3 Entretainment ,2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, 1 [ICON_Production] Production.
All units heal every turn, even after moving or combat. +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in Tundra tiles.
All unit gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Tundra or Snow. Camps give 1+ [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith.

Drakkari Troll unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Unique Drakkari Troll improvement. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_FOOD] if next to a Lake.

All units heal every turn, even after moving or combat. Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. +100% Harbor district adjacency bonuses. Grass and Plain Mountains provide +1 adjacency bonus for Theater and Holy Site.
All melee units gains additional +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for all fisher boats.

Zandalari Troll unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Stronger but slower than the Knight. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Troll unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Zandalari unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Zandalari unique Ancient era naval unit that replaces the Galley. Can pillage enemy coastal lands and capture civilians if adjacent using its coastal raiding ability.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center.
Orc unique melee unit, replace Warrior but stronger. Can build Watch Towers.

Orc unique Medieval era anti-cavalry unit, replace pikeman. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Troll unique Ancient era naval unit that replaces the Galley. Can pillage enemy coastal lands and capture civilians if adjacent using its coastal raiding ability. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement while in coastal waters.
Tauren unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Forsaken unique melee unit. -3 [ICON_Strength] to enemies next to him.
Blood Elf unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit, replace Knight. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Elven unique ranged siege unit. +5 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength vs. land units.
High Elf unique unit. Yields 15% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Science] Science on combat victory.
Goblin unique Medieval era melee unit, replace Swordsman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Gold] Gold on combat victory.
Goblin unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. Stronger and with more ranged than normal
Goblin unique naval unit, replace Quadrirreme. Invisible unless next to it.
Goblin unique siege unit, replace the Catapult. It has less attack than the normal catapult but its much faster.
Human unique ranged unit, replace the Crossbowman. Has more ranged attack than normal Crossbowman.
Stormwind unique heavy cavalry unit, replace the Knigth. +5 Combat Strength vs. anti-cavalry.
Human unique ranged unit. Heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Night Elf unique melee unit. When defeating an enemy unit, spread their religion to nearby cities.
Night Elf unique medic suport unit.
Night Elf unique unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is an Apostle, Inquisitor, or Missionary in the same hex.
Draenei unique anti-cavalry unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Worgen unique recon unit, replace the Scout. Invisible unless next to it.
Gnome unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace Crossbowman. Stronger and with more ranged than normal.
Gnome unique ranged unit. Heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Argent Crusade unique medic suport unit.
Burning Legion unique melee unit. +5 ranged attack vs. land units.
Burning Legion unique anti-cavalry unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] to enemies next to him.
Burning Legion unique ranged unit. Less ranged attack but with more movement and can move after attacking.
Burning Legion unique heavy cavalry unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] to enemies next to him.
Burning Legion unique light cavalry unit. Heals after defeating an enemy unit.
Burning Legion unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Burning Legion unique ranged siege unit. +5 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength vs. land units.
Burning Legion unique suport unit with ranged attack.
Twilight Hammer unique ranged unit. Heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Twilight Hammer unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Kaldorei unique ranged unit. Heals every turn, even after moving or combat. Yields 15% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Science] Science on combat victory.
Lordaeron unique heavy cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on your capital's continent. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing units.
Dwarf unique Medieval era melee unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Mogu unique Medieval era melee unit, replace swordman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Culture] Culture on combat victory
Mogu unique melee unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Mogu unique Medieval era anticavalry unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Mogu unique Medieval era ranged unit, replace crossbowman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Culture] Culture on combat victory
Mogu unique Medieval cavalry unit. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Mogu unique Medieval light cavalry unit. Cheaper and don't require Horses.
Mogu unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Pandaren unique melee unit. Can move after attacking.
Pandaren unique anticavalry unit. Heals every turn.
Pandaren unique Medieval era heavy cavalry unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Pandaren unique Medieval light cavalry unit. Faster and don't require Horses.
Pandaren unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.
Pandaren unique melee unit, replace Warrior. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Orc unique ranged unit. Heals every turn, even after moving or combat.

Orc unique Medieval era unit. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Unique anti-cavalry Medieval era unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on coastal tiles.
Unique ranged unit that replace the Archer, but it's stronger and available later in the Classical Era. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on coastal tiles.
Unique melee unit. Can move after attacking.
Illidari unique air unit, its available earlier in the game.

Provides double the tile's Appeal in [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. Can only be built on Coastal Desert, Coastal Plains, or Coastal Grassland tiles. Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking. Give +1 Gold and +1 Culture.

Provides an increase to [ICON_Strength] Defense. Bonus to [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to other segments. Additional [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism as you advance through the Technology Tree for adjacent segments. Must be built in a line along the borders of your empire.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Cannot be built on Snow or Snow Hills.
+2 [ICON_Food] Food. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every Farm next to it. Can only be built on Plains or Grasslands next to a River.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every fishing boats next to it. It can only be built on coast tiles and has to be more than 3 tiles distance from another Steam Pump.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production. +1 [ICON_Science] Science for every mine next to it. It has to be more than 2 tiles distance from another Manaforge.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Burning Legion unique building that replace the Barracks. +40% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in this city. Gives 2 [ICON_Production] Production, 2 Points for Great Generals and 1 Housing. Adds to air slots.
A unique building that adds 2 air slots in the city center. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Unique Mogu Building that replace the Workshop. Gives +3 [ICON_Production] Production and +2 Points for Great Engineer. Provides two slots for Air Units.
